p: The HAI test is based on the fact that many viruses agglutinate erythrocytes in vitro. Antibodies present in test sera prevent this haemagglutination. Although HAI antibodies are long-lasting and the test is of high sensitivity, it lacks specificity [ 40, 41]. However, it remains useful as a rapid screening test for viruses with common antigenic groups in epidemiological studies [ 34].
